```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
```

## R Markdown



```{r}
pws <-read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CelesteDodge/PepperwoodVegPlots/master/HOBO/PPW_HOBO_2013_Master.csv")

```

## Check the imported columns

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{echo=FALSE}
str(pws)
head(pws)
pws$tsfmt<- as.POSIXct(pws$Date.Time,format="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
head(pws)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{echo=FALSE}
pws %>% group_by(Plot,HR) %>% summarise(minHrlyTemp = min(x),maxHrlyTemp = max(x)) %>% as.data.frame() %>% mutate(siteN= as.character(site)) %>%group_by(siteN) %>% summarise(minSite=min(minHrlyTemp)))

```
